means: 使吃惊，使目瞪口呆( flabbergast的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Everybody was flabbergasted when I announced I was going to emigrate to Australia.
sentence.Network_cn: 我宣布要移民去澳大利亚时，所有人都惊呆了。

sentence.Network_en: Saying that Joan was taken aback is to put it mildly. She was completely flabbergasted.
sentence.Network_cn: 说琼吃了一惊,这是很保守的说法. 她其实是完全惊呆了.

sentence.Network_en: Fourth Master Liu was even more flabbergasted.
sentence.Network_cn: 刘四爷更没想到事情会弄到了这步天地.

1.ADJ-GRADED大为惊讶的;目瞪口呆的If you say that you are flabbergasted, you are emphasizing that you are extremely surprised. Everybody was.

entry.tran: 大为惊讶的;目瞪口呆的
entry.def: If you say that you are flabbergasted, you are emphasizing that you are extremely surprised.

example.ex: Everybody was flabbergasted when I announced I was going to emigrate to Australia.
example.tran: 我宣布要移民去澳大利亚时，所有人都惊呆了。

means.word_mean: 1. as if struck dumb with astonishment and surprise;

sentences.sentence: "a circle of policement stood dumbfounded by her denial of having seen the accident"
"was thunderstruck by the news of his promotion"
